channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-12646] SnapshotInfo tool does not find mob data in snapshots
item.description:
After taking a snapshot against a table with mob file data, the SnapshotInfo tool is not able to find the mob files even though they are present in the proper place. (<hbase>/mobdir/data/dfault/<table>/<region>/....)

Here's an example command line execution:


[jon@a1210 hbase]$ bin/hbase org.apache.hadoop.hbase.snapshot.SnapshotInfo -snapshot test -files

....

       - IntegrationTestIngestWithMOB/e9b5d936e7f55a4f1c3246a8d5ce53c2/test_cf/e75380c6db50db845dbdee48ab49381420141205f87d1b47b0f446c7acb3fa0656fa8a57 (NOT FOUND)



**************************************************************

BAD SNAPSHOT: 145 hfile(s) and 0 log(s) missing.

              0 hfile(s) corrupted.

**************************************************************

54 HFiles (54 in archive), total size 973.6 M (0.00% 0 shared with the source table)

0 Logs, total size 0

The missing files are actually present, it is likely that the snapshot tool doesn't know to look in the mob dir.
item.summary: SnapshotInfo tool does not find mob data in snapshots

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12685774/hbase-12646.patch
against master branch at commit 9e9be97af735a27769f4b348b72f065acaa1380c.
ATTACHMENT ID: 12685774

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

-1 tests included. The patch doesn't appear to include any new or modified tests.
Please justify why no new tests are needed for this patch.
Also please list what manual steps were performed to verify this patch.

-1 javac. The patch appears to cause mvn compile goal to fail.

Matteo Bertozzi, mind taking a look?
did you forget to include in the diff the line where you print the hfileMobCount/Size?

I just forgot to add output for the mob data.


  80.3 M IntegrationTestIngestWithMOB/e9b5d936e7f55a4f1c3246a8d5ce53c2/test_cf/e75380c6db50db845dbdee48ab49381420141205f87d1b47b0f446c7acb3fa0656fa8a57 (archive)



199 HFiles (54 in archive, 145 in mob storage), total size 10.7 G (0.00% 0 shared with the source table, 91.09% 9.7 G in mob dir)

0 Logs, total size 0

Added mob data size stats.
v2 handles mob sizes in SnapshotInfo output.
